criticism: The transfer function does not check if the recipient's balance will overflow before updating it. This can lead to an attacker setting an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
The transferFrom function does not check if the recipient's balance will overflow before updating it. This can lead to an attacker setting an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
The receiveApproval function does not check if the recipient's balance will overflow before updating it. This can lead to an attacker setting an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
The distributeTokens function does not check if the recipient's balance will overflow before updating it. This can lead to an attacker setting an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
The mintToken function does not check if the recipient's balance will overflow before updating it. This can lead to an attacker setting an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
The freezeAccount function does not check if the recipient's balance will overflow before updating it. This can lead to an attacker setting an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
The setPrices function does not check if the recipient's balance will overflow before updating it. This can lead to an attacker setting an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
The buy function does not check if the recipient's balance will overflow before updating it. This can lead to an attacker setting an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
The sell function does not check if the recipient's balance will overflow before updating it. This can lead to an attacker setting an arbitrary user's balance to any value.
